Table of Contents

Class AppInt

Namespace
Booseapp
Assembly
Booseapp.dll

Represents an application-defined integer variable/command. Inherits from BOOSE.Evaluation so it can be declared, stored, and used in expressions.

public class AppInt : Evaluation, ICommand

Constructors

AppInt()

Initializes a new instance of the AppInt class.

public AppInt()

Properties

Value

Gets or sets the current integer value of this variable.

public override int Value { get; set; }

Property Value

int

Methods

Compile()

Compiles the integer variable declaration and (if provided) validates and assigns its expression.

public override void Compile()

Exceptions

StoredProgramException

Thrown when the expression is invalid or when a real value is assigned to an integer.

Execute()

Executes the integer command. No runtime action is required because assignment is handled at compile time.

public override void Execute()

Set(StoredProgram, string)

Sets the variable name and optional assignment expression from the provided parameter string. Accepts forms such as: x or x=10.

public override void Set(StoredProgram program, string param)

Parameters

program StoredProgram

The stored program that owns this variable.

param string

The parameter string containing the variable name and optional expression.
